questions.question: Which anticoagulant is most commonly used for complete blood count (CBC) testing?
questions.explanation: Ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA) is the preferred anticoagulant for hematology tests as it preserves cellular morphology.

questions.question: Which of the following red blood cell indices measures the average volume of red blood cells?
questions.explanation: Mean corpuscular volume (MCV) reflects the average size of red blood cells and helps classify anemias.

questions.question: In which condition is an increased reticulocyte count most commonly observed?
questions.explanation: Hemolytic anemia causes increased red blood cell destruction, leading to compensatory reticulocytosis.

questions.question: Which white blood cell type is most commonly elevated in bacterial infections?
questions.explanation: Neutrophils are the first responders to bacterial infections and their count increases during such conditions.

questions.question: Which of the following red cell abnormalities is associated with liver disease?
questions.explanation: Target cells are commonly seen in liver disease, due to increased membrane lipids.

questions.question: What is the normal reference range for hemoglobin in adult females?
questions.explanation: Normal hemoglobin levels in adult females range from 120–160 g/L.

questions.question: Which hemoglobin variant is most commonly found in sickle cell disease?
questions.explanation: Hemoglobin S (HbS) polymerizes under low oxygen conditions, leading to the sickling of red cells.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes basophilic stippling in red blood cells?
questions.explanation: Basophilic stippling results from aggregated ribosomes and is seen in lead poisoning and thalassemia.

questions.question: In coagulation testing, what is the primary purpose of activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT)?
questions.explanation: Activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) is used to assess factors of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways.

questions.question: Which cell is the precursor of all blood cell lines?
questions.explanation: Hematopoietic stem cells are multipotent cells in the bone marrow that give rise to all blood cell lineages.

questions.question: What is the anticoagulant used in erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) determination by the Westergren method?
questions.explanation: Sodium citrate is the recommended anticoagulant in the Westergren method for ESR measurement.

questions.question: Which platelet abnormality is commonly seen in Bernard-Soulier syndrome?
questions.explanation: Bernard-Soulier syndrome is a rare inherited platelet disorder characterized by giant platelets and defective adhesion.

questions.question: Which coagulation factor is deficient in Hemophilia A?
questions.explanation: Hemophilia A is caused by a deficiency of coagulation factor VIII, leading to bleeding tendencies.

questions.question: In which leukemia are Auer rods most commonly observed?
questions.explanation: Auer rods are needle-like azurophilic granules found in myeloblasts, typical in acute myeloid leukemia.

questions.question: Which laboratory finding is most suggestive of iron deficiency anemia?
questions.explanation: Iron deficiency anemia is characterized by low serum iron, increased total iron-binding capacity, and low ferritin.

questions.question: What is the characteristic red blood cell morphology in megaloblastic anemia?
questions.explanation: Megaloblastic anemia features macrocytic ovalocytes due to impaired DNA synthesis from vitamin B12 or folate deficiency.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to stain reticulocytes?
questions.explanation: New methylene blue is a supravital stain that highlights residual RNA in reticulocytes.

questions.question: Which parameter is calculated using hematocrit and red blood cell count?
questions.explanation: Mean corpuscular volume (MCV) is calculated using hematocrit divided by red blood cell count.

questions.question: Which term refers to variation in red blood cell size?
questions.explanation: Anisocytosis refers to variation in red blood cell size and is quantified by red cell distribution width (RDW).

questions.question: Which coagulation test is prolonged in vitamin K deficiency?
questions.explanation: Prothrombin time (PT) is prolonged in vitamin K deficiency due to decreased synthesis of factors II, VII, IX, and X.
